alert.note: Alert for Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 7:36AM EDT until September 28 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Logan. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Russellville, Adairville, Oakville, Cave Springs, Schley, Lickskillet, Danby, Old Volney, Dot and Whippoorwill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
